@@ -41,1 +41,1 @@
-inline bool os::must_commit_stack_guard_pages() {
+inline bool os::must_allocate_stack_guard_pages() {
@@ -43,3 +43,0 @@
-#if !defined(__FreeBSD__) || __FreeBSD__ < 5
-  // Since FreeBSD 4 uses malloc() for allocating the thread stack
-  // there is no need to do anything extra to allocate the guard pages
@@ -47,5 +44,0 @@
-#else
-  // FreeBSD 5+ uses mmap MAP_STACK for allocating the thread stacks.
-  // Must 'allocate' them or guard pages are ignored.
-  return true;
-#endif

@@ -3454,2 +3454,23 @@
-    if (stack_extent < (uintptr_t)addr) {
-      ::munmap((void*)stack_extent, (uintptr_t)(addr - stack_extent));
+    // stack grows towards lower address
+    //
+    // lower address first
+    //
+    // |             |
+    // |    stack    |
+    // |    frame    |
+    // |             | <----- stack_extent (stack end)
+    // |             |
+    // |xxxxxxxxxxxxx| <------ addr
+    // |xxxxxxxxxxxxx|
+    // |xxxxxxxxxxxxx|         stack-guard-pages
+    // |xxxxxxxxxxxxx| <------ addr + size
+    // |             |
+    // |             |
+    // |ooooooooooooo| <------ actually used by thread
+    // |ooooooooooooo|
+    // |ooooooooooooo|
+    // |ooooooooooooo| <------ stack start
+    //
+    // Truncate the mapping if there is overlapping.
+    if (stack_extent < (uintptr_t)addr + size) {
+      ::munmap((void*)stack_extent, (uintptr_t)(addr + size - stack_extent));
@@ -3457,0 +3478,1 @@
+    return os::pd_attempt_reserve_memory_at(addr, size, !ExecMem) != nullptr;
@@ -3459,1 +3481,1 @@
-  return os::commit_memory(addr, size, !ExecMem);
+  return true;
@@ -3475,1 +3497,1 @@
-  return os::uncommit_memory(addr, size);
+  return true;
